heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 21 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 5.9°C) and feels like temperature (down 5.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 876 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 13.4°C), dew point temperature (up 10.6°C), outside temperature (up 11.3°C), and cloud levels (up 415 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 875.9m lower than yesterday, 81.1m lower than the past week, 414.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1104m minimum and 3920m maximum, with an average of 1387.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1468.1m and 1801.8m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and little or no wind. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Weather patterns to stay the same.
